column4: Hi #Ubuntu, does anyone have any experience making a Lenovo U300s "Clickpad" work properly under 12.04?
or can send me in the right direction?
Yes, I think that's the proper name of a trackpad that is also a button
how do I find the correct driver for it?
Touchpad driver on the fabricant website
install System Profiler and Brenchmark, on the Software Center application. There you may find the name of all the components of your lappy
Once you have the name of the touchpad, paste it on Google for driver. You may find something
Driver must be Linux based, favour the .deb package. I couldn't guide you through another way.
Yes, it's possible to find it in Lenovo's Website, searching for the model of your lappy
I've seen that post before, it's a fix for one thing but not for all the problems the trackpad has
This driver is useless to me on linux, right? http://i.imgur.com/uTE0i.png
please try on terminal: sudo apt-get install xserver-xorg-input-synaptics.
if it shall not work, type this same 'xserver-xorg...' in synaptiks package mannager
Gotta go afk now. Good luck, dude.
left me with something that looks rightâ€¦ can someone tell me what xserver-xorg-input-synaptics is?
you're probably installing the packet which makes the touchpad work fine
Let's hope so. I have the same version of touchpad myself, here, and it works properly
